title: 3-Dimensional Sonic Phase-invariant Echo Localization. (arXiv:2306.08281v2 [cs.RO] UPDATED)
abstract: Parallax and Time-of-Flight (ToF) are often regarded as complementary in robotic vision where various light and weather conditions remain challenges for advanced camera-based 3-Dimensional (3-D) reconstruction. To this end, this paper establishes Parallax among Corresponding Echoes (PaCE) to triangulate acoustic ToF pulses from arbitrary sensor positions in 3-D space for the first time. tldr: 本文提出了基于对应回波的视差定位技术（PaCE），通过新颖的往返反射模型和Siamese MLPs叠加得到的特征相似性进行通道内回波关联学习，从放宽传感器位置约束的情况下进行相位无关的三维物体定位。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a phase-invariant 3D object localization method called PaCE, which uses a novel round-trip reflection model and Siamese MLPs for inter-channel echo association learning. It enables 3D localization with relaxed sensor position constraints using only one isotropic emitter and at least three ToF receivers.
